item.title: Lots of fly-tipped material on Aldeburgh Street, 20th July
item.description:
We would like to report persistent and gross fly-tipping on to Aldeburgh Street. Some photographic evidence is attached and the people who live at an address on Woolwich Road have also been observed in the act by three residents of the Aldeburgh & Fearon Streets Neighbourhood Watch. The attached photos show the enormous jumble of stuff that has been left on Aldeburgh Street. One of the photos (of the Domino Pizza box) in the pile of fly-tipped material even shows the address to which it was delivered.. The fly-tipping is unsightly, unhygienic, impedes the passage of wheelchairs and baby buggies and serves as a magnet for others to fly-tip at that spot. As a conscientious NeighbourhoodWatch, we have conducted litter-picks in our area for more than five years, of which three-and-a-half years were alongside IKEA. We take great pride in our area. Please can you help.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fearon Street, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter Issues on Elmstead Lane - Request for Council Support, 20th July
item.description:
Dear Bromley Council, — I’m writing to raise concerns about the ongoing litter problem along Elmstead Lane, particularly the long stretch near Elmstead Woods Station. This area gets very busy during peak hours with commuters, school children, and pedestrians—and has unfortunately become a regular hotspot for littering. — For the past two years, I’ve been picking up rubbish from this stretch twice a week, often filling a full black bin bag. Despite my efforts, the issue persists. In the five years I’ve lived here, I’ve never seen a Council litter picker on Elmstead Lane, though they are often seen on other roads in Chislehurst. — I’ve also spoken with many neighbours—both retired residents and those working from home—and they’ve all confirm not seeing any Council Litter pickers on Elmstead Lane. I’d be grateful if the Council could: A) Confirm whether Elmstead Lane is included in the regular street cleaning schedule, and how often it is currently cleaned. B) Consider the following measures to help prevent further littering: Install bins near the bus stops along Elmstead Lane and nearby Sundridge Avenue. These are busy stops, especially with train station traffic, and the lack of bins leads to litter being dropped on pavements and roads. Install anti-litter signs along the wooded, bramble-covered stretch of Elmstead Lane (backing onto Sundridge Park Golf Club). This area is often used as a dumping ground by people in passing cars and vans. Signs such as “Please Don’t Throw Your Litter Here – Help Keep This Area Clean” could act as a simple but effective deterrent. The residents in this area really would appreciate the Council’s support in keeping Elmstead Lane clean.- My contact: Subhanur.Chowdhury@gmail.com
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lubbock Road, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The logistics centre in unit 5-9 is causing litter, urination outside our house., 20th July
item.description:
For >6 months, the food delivery center in Units 5-9 has let Ubereats/Deliveroo riders congregate outside our house and play music, smoke, urinate, and leave litter. We spoke to the facility, their toilet has been broken & they have no sun shelter.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Yorkton Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Children's swing, roundabout and see saw needs fixing, 20th July
item.description:
Hi - the kids roundabout ride in the Harvington sports ground has been jammed for over a year, seems like over the years dead leaves have gone in and blocked the ride, can you please get it checked and fixed. Also the swing needs greasing as it hardly moves, and the see saw after the repairs is soo hard that it doesn’t work as see saw at all and it’s just stuck in one position. It’s a lovely park and play area but just needs some repairs so the community can enjoy it! Please action ASAP.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): South Eden Park Road, Eden Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet
